intro: Ruellia guttata, commonly known as the spotted ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia guttata is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
